Activity: Start the day with a smile! Log into the EHR system and check for any urgent messages or notifications related to patient care or system updates. Grab a coffee – gotta be ready to bring the energy!
Review the daily patient schedule and identify patients presenting with potential influenza symptoms. Mentally prepare for a busy day of patient interaction.
First patient interaction: Greet the patient warmly and begin the influenza symptom assessment. Use the standardized protocols and tools within the EHR to guide the assessment.
Accurately and completely enter the patient's demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, and present symptoms into the EHR. Double-check for any errors.
Second patient interaction: Repeat the influenza assessment process, ensuring accurate and empathetic patient communication.
Enter data from the second patient encounter into the EHR, paying close attention to detail. Note any relevant observations or concerns.
Take a short break to stretch and re-energize. Maybe check out a funny meme to lighten the mood.
Third patient interaction: Conduct another influenza symptom assessment, making sure the patient feels heard and understood.
Input the third patient's information into the EHR, focusing on accuracy and completeness. Make sure to document any medications the patient is currently taking.
Lunch time! Head to the cafeteria and catch up with colleagues. Maybe share some funny stories from the morning.
Fourth patient interaction: Assess patient for influenza symptoms, ensuring a thorough and compassionate evaluation.
Document findings from the fourth patient encounter in the EHR, including any lab orders or referrals.
Fifth patient interaction: Continue patient assessments. Maintaining a positive and engaging attitude is key!
Enter patient data into the EHR. If unsure about a specific data entry point, email @HIS-1 and @MRS-1 to clarify on EHR specifications. Subject: EHR Data Entry Clarification
Sixth patient interaction. Focus on effective communication to ensure the patient clearly understands the information being shared.
EHR data entry for the sixth patient, confirming all fields are populated correctly.

Check in with @Clinlead-1 to discuss any trends observed in the influenza symptom assessments and identify any areas for improvement in the assessment process. Subject: Influenza Assessment Process Review
Review all EHR entries for the day, ensuring accuracy and completeness. Correct any errors or inconsistencies.
Prepare for tomorrow by reviewing patient schedules and anticipating potential needs. Gather any necessary supplies or information.
Sign out of the EHR system and head home. Time to relax and recharge for another exciting day!
